name: Organization manager cannot move another user’s dataset into other user’s project (?)
description:
>The docs say an _account manager_ is an _implicit_ editor of its users datasets and projects. When I want to move a users dataset into a users project I get a `pycrunch.lemonpy.ClientError` saying `Only project editors can move this dataset to another project.` although I have edit permissions on that project

>on alpha there is a dataset and project named `testing_skr` on which `sebastian.kriems@yougov.de` is the owner and (current) editor. I get both w/o beeing listed as a member/editor in both, I can push rows w/o beeing the `current_editor` of the dataset but I can't move it into the project

name: Edit names of slides
description: Stephen (YouGov Singapore office director) asks: "Is there any way to change or append the name of the variable when it’s saved to a deck? See attached crunch_deck for example of what I’m talking about. The use case is that we’re starting to use the decks feature a lot more with clients, but we often save slightly different treatments of the same variable to the deck. I noticed the decks do indicate additional variables added as columns or tabs, but not as filters. So If I save 1 variable twice, one with a filter and one without, it still shows the same variable name in the deck. It would be great if the save feature appends a filter label to the variable when saved as well. But even better than that would be the ability to create a custom name for the saved variable."
